snippet: State Street, a manager of institutional assets, said that it planned to cut 630 jobs, or about 2 percent of its global work force, to reduce expenses.
abstract: State Street, manager of institutional assets, says it plans to cut 630 jobs, or about 2 percent of its global work force, to reduce expenses; reports fourth-quarter net income rose 26 percent to $468 million, or $1 a share, compared with $371 million or 76 cents a share year earlier.
lead_paragraph: State Street, a manager of institutional assets, said that it planned to cut 630 jobs, or about 2 percent of its global work force, to reduce expenses.

headline.main: State Street Plans Job Cuts to Reduce Expenses
headline.print_headline: State Street Plans Job Cuts To Reduce Expenses
